page.title: 18LOCAL CUSTOMS,WEST KILBRIDE
page.content: {EASTER SUNDAY On Easter Sunday a large number of people from all the churches in the village make their way up to the top of Law Hill to conduct a{sunrise {service}to celebrate Easter.After hymns and a prayer all the children roll their Easter eggs down the hill.The egg is supposed to be a symbol of new life. {GALA QUEEN Another popular custom is the crowning of the Gala Queen. This is an annual event which takes place during Gala Week in mid-summer. {FLOWER SHOW The local Flower Show is also an annual event which is extremely popular. It receives entries from many people, young and old.
